title: Dentyne Ice gum logo
content:
Hi....need some help....I need to match the type face that Dentyne uses for their packaging.

There’s a jpeg attached. It’s not the “ice” part I’m looking for, but the “Dentyne” part.

Thanks a lot.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Dentyne.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017075638/http:/typophile.com/files/Dentyne.jpg) | 97.5 KB |

 [‹ (x) meat on the menu - Cheltenham {Stephen, Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017075638/http:/typophile.com/node/15456 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Luma brush script - Kid TYPEPaint {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017075638/http:/typophile.com/node/15306 "Go to next forum topic")
author: onammio

comments.content:
If you oblique (slant) a very heavy version of Joanna, I think you would get pretty close. See [MyFonts Test Drive (unslanted)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017075638/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/joanna/mt-extra-bold/testdrive.html?s=Dentyne&p=48)

- Mike Yanega
